name: Paraneoplastic Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (PNMOSD)
chief_complaint: I've been having blurry vision, weakness in my legs, and I feel like I can't control my bladder anymore.
symptoms: Lhermitte's sign (electric shock sensation with neck flexion)

lab_results.CT chest/abdomen/pelvis: occult small cell lung carcinoma (2.1cm right hilar mass)

prognosis: Guarded - neurological damage may be permanent even with treatment; 5-year survival ~40% due to underlying malignancy
description: A rare paraneoplastic syndrome where antibodies against aquaporin-4 (AQP4-IgG) cross-react with both neural tissue and occult malignancy, causing severe demyelination of optic nerves and spinal cord. Often associated with small cell lung cancer. Distinct from classic NMO by its rapid progression and poorer response to immunotherapy.
